hukl6EBxQr1s8YDsuU-4zw.text: So the family was hangry after a long hike went to this place great location and atmosphere but horrible service overall mostly because the kitchen took more than an hour to send out our food we will never go here again

tNJKV_pqG417uCCmIOsW4A.text: this locations customer service needs help.  The receptionist don't listen, and are to busy flirting with men customers. I was very offended when I came to the podium and told the girl I was picking up my order, she looked me up and down and asked is this for door dash or postmate...I was so offended, did she ask any of the other guests who were picking up if they were delivery services , NO. I was told a 15-20 minute wait for my food, it's been over 30minutes and I am still waiting. I wouldn't be surprised if my order was wrong also   I won't be coming back to this location again. My sweet tots were burnt

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Burnt sweet tots

SD6z7hNB8WRRPRlPQVQDMg.text: I really like this location: the atmosphere is great and the food is delicious. They always over quote the wait time, so be patient, it usually won't be as long as they say. Definitely a great lunch or dinner!

hyk3RABjvRduzWVhvEjuqg.text: Bummer. We used to go to CB&C years ago and liked it just fine. Then service and quality seemed to taper off so we stopped going--nothing terrible, we just weren't drawn back. So then recently someone told us they were back and it's great again! So we gave it another shot and it was pretty good! Due to happy hour and the other specials we made it our Wednesday spot.  Sadly, we started running into little issues again, most of which were handled by staff or management--but not today. Our server obviously didn't want to be there. It wasn't that busy but we waited a long time for our food when the table next to us came in well after us and got their food minutes after we did. My burger was all but cold. Our server didn't come back before happy hour was over (or much at all so I had to get up and go find silverware on my own) so I only got one drink--that's not a big deal, but then she charged me full price for the drink I did get during happy hour which is the same drink I always get a happy hour discount on. When I asked about it, she just told me I was wrong.    Some wasted time and a few bucks really doesn't sound like that big of a deal, but it's enough to keep us from going back.

XoAhJOaoPYCsH2zF9NTEKQ.text: I really liked the ambiance of this place! There is supposed to be one opening near our house near 67th Ave and Deer Valley Rd in North Peoria/Glendale area. I can't wait to have a cool bar/grill to hang out at and be able to also take the family!   This place in Scottsdale was cool, the location was great and our service was great too. We went for a girlfriend of mine's birthday last month. About 5 of us total, we did a little bar hopping and enjoyed this place as a chill hang out with good drinks and food!!  We had the buffalo dip- YUM! And a couple other things but the dip is what I remember most! Haha The drinks were good and not weak, my hubby even made a comment about it, so that's saying something. I hope the location by us will be similar! :) They would have some regulars on their hands over here.   Overall I definitely recommend it and would go back to the Scottsdale location, however I am looking forward to the location that will be opening up near us soon. :)

UTLgXuzR8FXARgguB-x1ZA.text: The service here is usually so-so at best, but you don't come here for that- you come for the food. My favorite is the Buddha Mac and Cheese or the Juicy Lucy burger.   However, we came on a Wednesday night and it was the worst it has ever been. We only saw our server 3 times- take our order, bring the food, and then the bill. We had to ask for our own drink refills from other servers because ours was no where to be seen. Our food took upwards of 50 mins to arrive, 50!! And it was not great to say the least. My beloved mac and cheese dish (which I specifically came here for) was not fresh. I could tell that it had been sitting under the heat lamp for way too long because it was dry and stuck together. My friend got the buffalo chicken totchos and ended up getting food poisoning later that night...! Bad chicken. Our server never apologized for the wait nor acknowledged anything about the lack luster service.   I am very patient and understanding about how people/places get busy and behind but you at least need to be proactive about it and put your guests first. It would have gone a long way if she had something like "Sorry it's been awhile guys, we're short staffed tonight and doing the best we can."   It's just overall very disappointing because I did enjoy coming here for the unique menu options but last night were the final strikes.

uSJwPIsrkhlsdXX-RVfEEw.text: I hesitate to give this place a 2 star, because as a vegetarian, I LOVE their amazing veggie patties that you can sub for any burger. In the couple of times I've visited CBC I've had the ring of fire and the rocky point and I've loved them both-- and the sweet potato tots? Amazing!   However, on the occasions I've been to Cold Beer and Cheeseburgers, the service is terrible! The food can take upwards of 45 minutes to get to your table, and in that time no explanation is offered as to why, even when it isn't a busy game night or weekend. The server appears to take your drink order and your food order and disappears for the remainder of your stay until it's time to bring the bill. I'm a pretty understanding person, and forgive that when it's busy; but to happen on several occasions? No thank you. While the food is fantastic, it's a shame because the service downgrades this place significantly.  **Edit** Management contacted me and rectified the situation, which I appreciate greatly. I will have to give CB&C another chance.

A2Zh4NstV_3ghhbPIk3o2w.text: My boyfriend and I found this place from yelp and was craving a good burger. This place honestly reminded me of an ESPN Zone restaurant but smaller and much louder. I would recommend if you want to be able to have a conversation with your date, possibly sit outside or order to-go. While seated inside there was a group of women just screaming at the tv! It was obnoxious but I think this may have been the norm since no waitress addressed that group.   The food was good. I ordered he Jucy Lucy burger and my boyfriend got the Ring of Fire with the buffalo sauce on the side. I highly recommend if your ordering something spicy, get it on the side. Their menu warns: If you can't handle it, don't order it!  Both burgers were fine. We cut each one in half and shared so we could taste them both. There was too much burger bun for my liking. I wouldn't mind giving this place another chance. Most likely during lunch time- if that's quieter?

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. A whole lotta bun
Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ring of Fire*
Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Jucy Lucy*

V6pqd-xiDcEo0pdAujxGQA.text: Just had an awful lunch experience here!! If you're heading here I hope you read this in time to not waste a meal! For full disclosure, I have been here before with my wife, son and other family several times before and had an enjoyable meal, some beer, etc. Today's lunch visit was one of those that makes you decide to never come back. So many other options. We sat down (4 of us) and ordered our food. Nothing complicated. After waiting about 25 minutes we asked for a status on our food. We were told it is up next and did not see the waitress again. 5 minutes later the 2 people at the table next to us received their food. After a total of 30 minutes I asked for a manager and she did not immediately come. Our food arrived after about 45 minutes after ordering. The waitress blamed the kitchen and how busy the restaurant was (which it was not....it was busier on our previous visits. Still no manager who did eventually arrived about 10 minutes after our food. I tried the Nashville chicken and it was burned (way over fried). Also the portion was laughable (pictured below). The manager explained they do it by weight....maybe 2 ounces. I told her it's not very good. The manager acknowledged that the table next to us put their order in after us but had no explanation for the wait. The manager checked our bill and said she would come the food but could not comp the one beer we had. That's fine if that's the rule. Then waitress brings us the check which includes a beer and an iced tea. We questioned the iced tea and she said the manager said you'd pay for both. At that point, I could care less and we paid and were on our way. I definitely feel the waitress forgot to put our order in and rather than own her mistake, she lied and made up excuses. Mistakes happen. Just own them and all is good.   This is all a shame because we have enjoyed the outdoor seating, watching NFL games, etc and based on one bad experience we won't be coming back. Bad service trumps everything!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Ky727QOff9JnMFDbeixkRw.text: We have been to many locations in the past and love our burgers and brew.   Last night was just ok.  All of us found our burgers that were to be done medium rare to be over cooked.   The flavors and juiciness of past experiences just wasn't there.  I tried to get it lettuce wrapped for the first time and I won't do that again.  Three ordered  onion rings and they were hot and good.   It just seemed like they were just not having the best night.   Very slow...  have to give this location another shot on another day

Qc-3GKSuWiBUPHIJwkh_QQ.text: My husband and I stopped here for a burger and to watch the games. We had an initial 15 minute wait when arriving. We ended up waiting over 25 minutes. We got sat at a corner table near some of the loudest people. Our server was not friendly, she clearly didn't like her job. We ordered a appetizer, it came quickly, but we ended up waiting over 30 minutes to order lunch.  Our meal was good, and overall it was a good experience. Just don't expect to hear anything or get fast service on a Sunday during football season.

9_bvxyyRVEV4zrtOyl0GgQ.text: This place is always packed being that it's in popular old town area. Great food, great loud sports setting with TVs everywhere with all the major games and fun lively atmosphere. Today we waited for about 15 minutes and got a table on the patio where they had large overhead heat lamps which made it super cozy. I ordered the broccoli cheddar bacon mac n cheese with a Riesling and my bf ordered a thousand island burger with chips and a beer. Grace was our server she was hoppin it was super busy but she did great! We will definitely be back as always. Thanks cold beers!

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

xzQZHVMXUq7L7SQS7p25LA.text: We were in town over WMO weekend and tried to stop here Friday night for dinner around 945p, and they were on an hour and a half wait.. obviously, with a wait like that, it must be great so we decided to try and check it out another time when it was less busy.   We went back for lunch on super bowl Sunday. The drinks were good and the service was excellent. Everyone in the group really liked their burgers, fries, and appetizers. The mac and cheese was relatively average, but all in all it was a really good, moderately priced experience. I'd definitely recommend it for someone looking for a nicer sportsbar in the area.

FopExxfwE4vNC-e0a6er0g.text: My wife & I had our usual great time !  Both our burgers were cooked to order ; I tried the coleslaw ( being from Long Island , NY you can understand how spoiled I am w/ the Kosher deli slaw ) ; VERY GLAD I DID ! One of the mgrs ( Dereck ) visited our table & was most gracious ! Of course , we'll be back !

cFkUIJZUDNbdfjtvzbGSdg.text: The atmosphere of this spot is why you'd come here. Lots of TVs and draft beer. The food is mediocre though we didn't eat any of the burgers, which someone said they were known for. The service was good, not excellent, but those girls behind the bar never stopped moving because it was so busy on a Sunday afternoon.

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Some Red Bull drink
Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Mac and Cheese with jalapeño, asparagus, and bacon. I thought it was delicious!
Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Monterey Chicken sandwich. A bit dry and the bread was tasteless and not soft. The fries were good!

pc9J0MfWJKYOahmsGzrW7g.text: In Tempe, AZ on a business trip and run into a bud from LAX- Los Angeles. He's referred to this place for a meet up and some eats.    I Uber to Scottsdale, thinking this place was far, it was a $10 ride, and kinda scenic! Enjoyed my drivers conversation, AAA Ball player for the Oakland A's , and from the Dominican Republic , trying to make his dreams come True!     I meet up with my buddy here, and it's packed, locals and non locals, walk to wall big screen TV's, and we got a good view of the GSW - Warriors BB game.    We ordered up some wings and sliders and a few drinks. We order this brisket slider w/ bacon and pbj, yup Peanut Butter and Jelly! Dang! Those sliders rocked! The wings were a bbq mustard grilled, but they never mention the heat you get on the first bite!!!   Well, we started at 8p and it's 1am, and we're the last to leave! I didn't mention we were joined by his daughter, son-in-law and his buddy, which added to the lengthy stay and good time!!! I hope to hook up with this bunch again! They are funny!!!    Resturant service, food and drinks were great!

70iykqip3rfQnoWoJZjb6A.text: Me and my girlfriend came here after a hike looking to replenish and refuel after a tough Camelback hike. We sat at the bar and the bartender came over and greeted us asking if she can get some drinks started for us. I tell her just a minute but we'll take some waters. Another bartender then comes over and asks for both of our IDs so I give her mine but my girlfriend didn't bring hers and wasn't planning on drinking but she said you have to have an ID to sit at the bar-OK, kind of annoying but I respect the policy so we moved to a table 3 feet away, really accomplished a lot there especially on a Sunday morning with an empty bar. We both order the Monterey chicken sandwich for 14.50$, kind of pricey for a sandwich but given the location I can understand it. The thing that was annoying is it came with chips but for 2$ more you can get fries or another side. If you're paying 14.50 for a sandwich, you shouldn't have to pay another 2$ for f**king fries. No one wants chips with their meal so it seems kind of purposeful to make chips the standard so you have to pay another 2$ to have a satisfying meal. You'd think at a cheeseburger place the fries would come standard, guess not. The server was nice, forgot a drink but apologized and ran it out quickly after. The food also came out fast and I was pleasantly surprised with the taste. Good chicken sandwich, we both enjoyed it. The chicken was moist and the bacon seemed fresh. I read some previous reviews on here saying the chicken was dry so I was expecting the worst, but for 16.50 for a chicken sandwich and a decent side it better be the best chicken sandwich I've ever had and it wasn't. I ordered a beer and went with the big size and was expecting a big beer stein but it was smaller than what I thought it was going to be. For 7.50$ a beer I thought it would come in a stein. Overall, decent experience, wouldn't recommend it to anyone but on a whim and not wanting to wait for the breakfast place across the street, it did the job. You can't have premium prices and not perform on them, I feel like the majority of all reviews of this place touch on this. Cold beers and cheeseburgers, a solid plan b.

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

_Pv1bcp1Ac354ajq4wd5qQ.text: Burgers are fantastic (duh!) Great beer selection and terrific staff.

GAOJYXlIiap12FkFxB7gJg.text: Surprisingly good and entertaining for the family. The truffle fries were to die for to start our meal. The burger was also delightful. Great burger with a beer ofcourse. The place overall was fun and I strongly suggest an outside seat.

DjqVu0q1Y1GQG7Kq7PQKpQ.text: It is a solid 4 star, food is as described.  Sandwiches are fully packed with good quality ingredients.  I had a pastrami sandwich, very tasty.   It comes with chips but l preferred fries.  The fries were extremely salty.  An extra charge for the fries and it wasnt worth it since l couln'd bear the overseasonning.  Ron had a Turkey club sandwich, again loaded with meat and on point.  He too said the fries were too salty.

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Nice pastrami sandwich!
Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lots of roasted turkey in the club sandwich!
Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Oversalted fries!

-qF4X7cbUZeE7I_G56Jdxg.text: Looks like the pricing leveled off for now..at least until they build the next location.  Still bitter about: Upcharge for Fries (should never happen)    Spring Training happy Hour cancellation  The pretzels now need some attention - they are just not good anymore and the cheese sauce that goes along is as dated as this location. BTW when is that next door expansion coming? The pretzels are more shiny, than tasty, more air than bread. You still get two at happy Hour, but 6 years ago they used to be tops in town, but now just a bad pretzel. Happy Hour domestic beers remain 3 bucks and plenty of sports still on the tubes, so will continue to frequent this place once in awhile.

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Outdated snacks

4VPdhu1pBFMhW19NOVmUkA.text: It's a bummer when you go to a place that specializes in cheeseburgers and you order a cheeseburger medium and get a charred piece of gray meat instead.   The beer was cold at least.

f54lAIH7pbSGKPhHZptqYQ.text: My wife and I stopped ny for lunch. Very nice service, great location and very good ambience. Emma ordered a pastrami sandwich and I ordered a turkey club both with fries as a side. The sandwiches were excellent however the bacon on my club had no flavor at all. We both had a generous portion of fresh meats which was an addes plus. The only problem I had were the fries that came with both sandwiches. They were seasoned with way too much salt.  They were difficult to eat. They provide salt and pepper at each table so how about letting their patrons season then the way they like them. Won't stop us from going back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Cjc27d-Ax7MB-RTiUkL0gg.text: We came on a Tuesday night after the happy hour ended so it wasn't busy by any means. This is a bar environment so we weren't expecting to be overwhelmed by the decor but it was actually cute and the outdoor patio had misters which made it comfortable. Unfortunately, the food just wasn't good. We ordered the Juicy Lucy and I had the onion burger which came out just so so as you could tell they had sat for a little while back there. They took about 30 minutes to make which we didn't complain about but to have your name include cheeseburgers, I would assume your burgers would be great. Our burgers came out underwhelming and the bun was soggy which is a big pet peeve of mine. I would have asked the server for another bun but she was too busy on her phone to notice we needed help. This place wasn't great by any means, I feel as though other local places in old town have better burgers so we would not recommend this place. Also, the manager appeared to have been there randomly walking around but not once did he come to any table that I saw to ask how the experience was. If he had, I would have told him my opinion. Don't order the sweet potato tater tots, they came out soggy and weren't worth the up charge. The fries my husband ordered were ok, but it's hard to mess up fries. The best thing about this place was the cold beer but you can get that anywhere. So avoid this one until they fix the issues.

XufKfh2f8PWkC0EN0sc-vA.text: Great Juicy Lucy Burger ....service good Jordan Helped us out and she was a star.

JH6dsmfQSzotNXTfHvBJUQ.text: Very good sports bar place with lot of TVS and huge amount of space. Very delicious food they have and including drinks that are reasonable. -Excellent Service  -Great Sports Bar  -Many TVs and space  -Outdoor Patio  -Great Food Options and Drinks

EzSXL72g9bGNWBy7_81ExQ.text: Please read this in it's entirety to understand how awful the service was at this place. It was 8pm and my friend and I had to wait for a table to open, so we had to walk around in the 100+ degree weather in Old Town. The restaurant said they would text us in 30-45 minutes. We waited exactly 35 minutes until we went back to the restaurant because it was so hot outside and we needed some A/C! The people at the front were both on their phones, whispering to each other and giggling when we walked in. We asked if they were ready for us. They kept gossiping and whispering while talking to us. They said that they had a table opened 10 minutes ago for us, but we had never gotten a text (even though they were both on their phones anyway)! We got sat down, and the waiter walked away without talking to us. We waited almost 10 min for them to ask what we wanted to drink, since we knew it was going to take a while for them to come back, we ordered our food too. The service got worse from here. A table full of people drinking beer was getting surrounded by girls of the wait staff flirting with the drunk men and not waiting on people. One girl was pacing around the restaurant. I watched her walk outside, inside, into the kitchen, and to the front. She never had anything in her hands or stopped at any tables. She joined the crowd at the drunk table. Our food finally came out and no one came back to us for quite a while, but when they did they asked if we wanted our check. We ordered dessert (the s'mores which is so good!! a tiny pot with a fire in it surrounded by marshmallows, graham crackers, and chocolate so u can cook them urself!), but it took an odd amount of time. When I go to Cold Beers, I usually order this for dessert. All that had to be done for this dessert is assemble the crackers, chocolate, and marshmallows and light the fire. It took 20 minutes and no one had come by our table. We finally asked a random waiter that wasn't our own to check on it for us. It came out 10 minutes later. We soon realized the flame was not lit. We found another waiter and told them, since we obviously could not light it ourself. The stuff inside to keep the flame lit could be toxic or need special care for all we know. The waiter took it into the kitchen and came back with it unlit. "Do you have a lighter?" she asked us. We were completely shocked. That is very unprofessional. She went back and got it lit. This experience took long enough, so when it was brought out FINALLY, we asked for the check. It was not split, even though we asked for it to be, so we had to wait for another check for us to each pay for what we ordered. We found and told the manager all of this. They gave the s'mores to us for free. Which was not at all worth it. We finally paid, which took a long time (obviously) for us to get our cards back after we paid. We got out around 10pm. Not a great experience. 10 is our curfew, so we of course missed that because of how long it took. Keep in mind, there were so many open tables the moment we entered, and the whole time we were there. I will never come back to this location. I have been here many times, but this was my last.

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

zb7Elwm4QDE0mPcRInp9rQ.text: Great service from waitress!! Great food! Only complaint is the snotty hostesses! If I based it on first impressions and not the food or waitress, it would have been 1/2 star!!

_zc5K3A9EtiTutKWjbTcYQ.text: This place was great!!! Burgers were off the hook great. All of these bad reviews are small people that have to complain to make a name. The build a burger was perfect. The waitress actually saved me money on a recommendation. Thank you! For the management: you have a great place with great servers. Be nice. That's your X factor. Anyway. Great place. But. Apparently beers aren't a free refill. Darn it. They kept bringing, I kept drinking. Thank you again

yQ-DzRjOM7e8LYqhMzNIaA.text: Loud and crazy! And the perfect burger and cccccccold beers.  Yep, seriously good burger! We each ate the whole damn thing ;)

rUKumauoVwl7AYGfY0ANeg.text: We went to the new Central Phoenix location.  The server was friendly, but it took 45 minutes for us to get our food.  Definitely not going back.

4dYMuBQXp8OcGReGlkHQIA.text: Yum, good burgers. I still like Hopdoddys better but this place has good food. The homemade chips are good but not great. Sweet Tater Tots were good but my friend says they are better at Stax. Hamburger was solid. Looks like they have a great beer selection too if that is your thing. It is in the restaurant's name after all. lol

7ZKbNOT8cgDE2UDRb3CQlw.text: Great open concept restaurant with tasty comfort food.   They have a nice selection of beer on tap, and a variety of food options for everyone including vegetarians (yay!).  We've been here a few times and every time it's crazy busy, so plan on waiting for a table especially during peak season. If you're going for happy hour I would suggest you call ahead and make sure they are still offering specials. For example, when we went during spring training they were not honoring happy hour specials. :(   I was back-and-forth on giving this place a 3 or 4 rating, but unfortunately the service is never been spectacular so that coupled with the happy hour situation ... dropped it down to a three.

Q1HKg22dTA1aIfhwjnLeXg.text: Service was quick and friendly, food came out just as ordered. Husband had the blue cheeseburger. It was perfectly cooked and the tots were delicious as always. Oldest son had the buffalo chicken burger with h onion rings. He was very pleased. The kids mac and cheese is a good size portion but it was barely warm and a bit bland but our little boy didn't notice.

Ky-pjJGhF6fP7ba0Ck6OKQ.text: Great food. Happy Hour was awesome. Went to use our 10% Yelp check in offer and the server only lets you use it if you write a review so beware.

wiSsuR3enC5S9OzH_h_Qsw.text: My husband and I like to come here for happy hour -- not for the drinks but $7.50 burger and $7 "frank-n-stein (substituting a soda for the beer). We came tonight, Friday, July 8, at 5:30 and found the place almost packed! By 6:00 people were waiting for a table or sitting outside. With misters running (and plenty of TVs), it must have been pretty pleasant. There was a wide age-range of people so it was welcoming regardless of one's age.

hIsAXTo3SIvzxOhLqTlQtg.text: My boyfriend and I came here for the  first time on the Fourth of July and I was so impressed! The food was perfect, but mostly the service was amazing. I have worked in customer service for a very long time and tend to be a customer service snob. The server was quick, I mean, really quick. And I was a full restaurant. The manager was out on the floor helping the servers and was making sure to chat and check in on guests. You don't see that very often anymore. I will absolutely come back and recommend this place!

bIogkffbAfiatoluAKHgJg.text: I just dont understand the hype here. 1st time I came here was for a football game and it was dead, which doesnt bother me, but the fact that I couldnt get any service when they weren't busy does bother me. Had the totchos and I couldn't finish them, they just weren't good. A couple months later I came back with my buddies and once again, bad service and medicore food, at best. They do have a pretty good TV set up though if you are going for sports, so maybe just stick with the drinks, sit at the bar, and stay away from the food. Personally, I think there are a lot better options in the area for Sports Bars.

A_35V4noYPG5trrDYe139Q.text: Came here this past Sunday for game-day and while I expected any bar/restaurant to be crowded on that day, this place was pretty insane. Not to mention, the acoustics are awful in the place. You had to literally shout at your bartender/waitress and even the person sitting next to you.  I will probably come back on an off-game day for late lunch or happy hour to get a better feel but my first impression was "meh".    Oh, and $7 for a fireball shot? Who are you kidding?!

_XUn1bpJMQ8hTxaBvx3Vuw.text: Great place to eat and fantastic appetizers and the service was quick and efficient. Wish we had one in northern Az! I liked the beer choices even though they changed out an IPA for the summer Shandy  (gross) otherwise seemed to have a great selection! I do think a nice have a good night or see ya later from host or any of the crew would have made this a 5 star review, but I work in the service industry so i am a little picky!

QNWZv-YWCSft9rICSY7Qwg.text: Met up with a friend staying in town at this place, thought it was just going to be another burger joint. Got there and tons of tvs to watch the games on, had a blast and great staff. Plenty of beer on tap if that's your thing. More of a mix drinker myself but the beer is definitely cold and the burgers are great.

FWbPmsMo9IJCpaZCLG_njQ.text: Service was pretty decent. Food was alright, way overpriced. However my huge problem is that I went to the bar because my drink tasted like watered down strawberry lemonade and asked for a little extra shot. The bartender rolled his eyes at me and gave me attitude like I was bothering him because I interrupted him from talking to the lonely girl at the bar. Anyway, he ended up putting a shot of well liquor in, fine, but then we found out they added that to our bill. A $7 shot of well liquor to spice up my watered down drink. Will not be returning.

NL3lxVHYTCOR5JfxuPHl3Q.text: Never lets me down.... I'm a hardcore greenbay fan! Get into the games more then anything.... So whe you have a server who finally comes to meet you in the middle of a play and talks to you while a touchdown is going on..... Then gets offended when you won't answer them because they "wasted there time" at your table.... It's childish! Love the food.... Service will continue to blow ! thanks ERIN!

tph--q7tHMzhZV6zYrdOJw.text: Sat for 20 minutes with nobody acknowledging our presence. Not even a drink order. Tables around us which were seated after us were helped.

VWovO3hTIMtP_fMsVnsL-w.text: My husband and I dropped by Scottsdale Arizona on the way back to California and found this restaurant. There happened to be a parade taking place that same day so it was pretty crowded. They have a patio sitting area looking out into the streets. Perfect spot for the parade. They specialize in burgers and beer. They have an option to build your own burger. Good variety of beer to chose from. Here's our comments on specific dishes:  1) Asian Chicken salad - I love peanut sauce and bits of fried wonton skin so it totally worked out for me. They didn't over kill on the dressing so I would highly recommend the salad.  2) The Staple Mac & Cheese - They used three different types of cheese and it mixed together very well. It was probably one of the best I've had. Server was right about it still being good after you reheat in the Microwave. They used thin curly noodles and topped off with some bread crumbs!! YUMMY!!! =)  3) Bacon Blue cheeseburger - Burger was good and the portion was big enough that you almost need fork and knife. I'm not a big blue cheese burger fan however my husband enjoyed it. He was only able to finish half.   Great place to hang out with friends and watch the game!  Remember to check in to get $5 off... =)

UTEkNCXT0aehLSBmvsqIaw.text: First Chicago dog I found since I moved here! Ingredients are fresh, chips and fries are home made, service is great, nothing really bad to say about this place

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best Chicago dog you can find in AZ
Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicago dog, fresh and delicious

YfMtLDqUuNi0Fo58w85dZQ.text: Great new burger spot in the heart of Scottsdale. I think they just opened in the beginning of July '13. I've been 3 times in the first month, and it's been better each time. The service is a little slow, but they're very nice and they made sure I got everything I wanted. I think that once they've been open a while the service will get better. The burgers were excellent each time & came out super hot.  You can make your own burgers or mac n' cheese here, and it comes out exactly how you want it. There's a big list of beers as well as you would expect from their name. There are TV's everywhere and they're all big. I will definitely be coming back here during football season.  Once this place gets their service locked in then it's a 5-star place for a bar/burger/sport type restaurant.

lHmyEFfxmhlehHrdx6fxkA.text: Only giving 3 stars because this is a great place to watch any football game you want... and because there is a Bloody Mary bar! Other than that food is really basic bar food. Hard to complain when I got to watch my Hawks, while sitting in the sun, sippin on my self-made to perfection Bloody Mary! Lots of people gathering to watch and root for their team made it extra fun and interesting. I always prefer more hawks fans in the room, being from Seattle, but this worked too. If you're looking for your football game you better believe it'll be playing on at least one of their many screens!

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sunshine, Bloody Mary from the Bloody Mary bar and football! Yes!!

YNTPerrXxWa8pO8vJzgu5w.text: Olivia from Alaska was an incredible server!  She recommended the Ring of Fire Burger and it was awesome. Great place to watch a game, have a drink and some solid food!!

jfjdCdH2Km_4pAhEuMeEYw.text: The food was awesome, they had a ton of TV's for football and our server Olivia recommended the bacon pb&j sliders which were unreal. Must try!

6rmDCbyOoAlJ7_XrfE_tFA.text: The over all experience of the service and food was great. The bartenders were on point and management was very attentive. Ordered a build your own burger and it was on point drinks were a-little pricey but over all a great place to catch up with fiends and family. Great out door seating available

mw5zrCurE4-HgGXr1XeZSQ.text: UFC atmostphere with sound on the TVs for the fights.  Our server Kylie was beyond attentive and had great beer suggestions (Big Blue Van). Tough environment with very loud noise but executed under harsh conditions and did a great job. Thanks for making it a great experience

pUCx-L-JSdWhCypcMxlMAA.text: Second time here. It's a go to for sports events for us when we are in the area. We had great service and felt the attention of management to get the TV's set to what customers wanted as tables change was really awesome. I got the build your own Mac and cheese, and they were very accommodating with my husbands keto friendly requests. All the food was satisfying as we expected. The build your own options are really cool! They have a burger too. Our server was Olivia and she really made our visit.

QEP5p5w9MiqaJbUIok807A.text: I love CBCB! It is one of my favorite go-to places for great service, delicious food, and perfectly chilled beers on tap. Last night i went in around 8pm and it was super busy. My boyfriend and i were given one of the last tables on the heated patio. Because it was busy, i expected there to be a delay in service (which is totally fine, i would have completely understood), but it was the opposite. We had an awesome server named Olivia. She was so friendly and probably the quickest server we have ever had. We ordered two beers... and not even 3 minutes passed and they were on the table. Her quick service was much appreciated during a busy night!! We cant wait to go back and will totally request to be sat in her section. Kudos girl, you rock!

5XIxXGJat5YS_zCTge50oQ.text: Sadie was my bartender & she was absolutely amazing. She has such a great energy, always smiling & having conversation with the customers. This place is so good! The food is off the chart & Sadie is the most adorable person ever! She took care of us from the moment we sat down til we left! I highly recommend this place & having Sadie as your bartender

x1x8MWpgOfMIDaVcErG3bA.text: Food was great and service was attentive. Atmosphere was great with good music and trivia night was a lot of fun. Will be back!

PLpTm0lu11Eawc1T1fQvkQ.text: $22 for a cheeseburger?!? GTFO. Never coming back. Waitress who took my phone order never told me the total or I would have declined. That's INSANE.

dGI5TIOprfgXx8yZT-CuFQ.text: 4 stars for the cheeseburgers and sweet potato tots. Like most greasy spoons, it's easy to consume a 2000 calorie meal here, so watch what you eat. We prefer to split a burger during happy hour with no drinks... MUCH cheaper that way. Get your own food and down a couple of drinks and you'll easily hit $25 a person for a burger. No thanks. I'd rather not drink away my hard earned money at a 400% markup. YMMV

3WU4HqoStDsCMvCpqJkg_g.text: The beer was indeed cold.  The cheeseburger was delicious. The staff was attentive and friendly. Our server, Cole, brought our food out piping hot, made certain we had everything we needed. No dearth of sports on the flat panels that were everywhere. Even the canned music, a bit loud for us, was pleasing (not head-banger). Nothing not to like really!

zRzL6EdqwEVLRrsNZubDSg.text: We returned the next night and enjoyed a few Happy Hour apps and a $12 Build Your Own Burger with unlimited toppings. The portion on the Hell Fire Chips is way too huge!! Really they need to serve about 1/2 to 2/3 of the amount and take a buck or $1.50 off the price. There's no way two people could eat that - or maybe offer two sizes - one size for two and one for a group of 4 or more. They were spicy and delicious with ranch dressing to cool them down.  The grilled asparagus were great - not overcooked at all with a nice charred flavor from the grill. The grilled tomatoes served with them were a nice touch.  We ordered a burger with a wheat bun (a tad dry :-( unfortunately), Swiss, bacon, jalapenos, red onions and mushrooms and the upcharge for onion rings (very good). It was delicious despite the slightly dry bun. ____________________________________  Original review:  For Chicago fans this place is great because they have WGN and we were able to see the Cubs game.  Many beers are $3 a can. They let us sit at the bar for 90 minutes and only had three beers total.  People around us looked pleased with their food.   We will be back for the next Cubs game!

OjTMWzw3Ob1JaE9Xrq3K1Q.text: I'm a little late on this review.  On November 19th my family took me here to celebrate my 60th birthday.  I have been to several different locations but not this one.  The one star is for the food which never disappoints.  The service is a whole different story.  After we were seated we waited for at least 15 minutes and my son finally ask if we could please get a server.  About 10 minutes later finally we had one.  We put in our drink order and an appetizer.  Our appetizer was served and eaten and we still did not have our drinks.  Finally a manager came and delivered drinks and apologized for the terrible service also assuring us we would have great service for the rest of our visit.  Oh no , not so much.  It took another 10 minutes or so for our server to come back take our dinner order.  Then another 10 or so to ask if we wanted more drinks.  The dinner itself took at least another 15 to 20 minutes to be delivered.  Our server was nice enough just very clear they were understaffed.  So all being said and done we were in there for almost 2 hours making us late to meet up with family at zoo lights.  When we got our bill our first round was paid for.  I can assure you we did not come there for a free round of drinks.  I will continue to go to Cold beer and Cheeseburgers just not this location ever again.  Too many other options in Scottsdale to put up with really really bad service

NqrvMbJS80_1tR02fCsy5w.text: Came here tonight with a group of 10.  We were told that the wait would be 45 min to an hour, but it turned into an hour and a half.  We were watching the NCAA March Madness at a nearby bar, so it was OK.  Our waitress was super sweet, but the kitchen was slow in cooking our food.  Atmosphere was fun, but music way too loud.  I ordered the bleu cheese and bacon burger.  It was cooked as I asked.  All in all it was a good place to go after seeing the Giants play a spring training game.

jke-vTHTaf7dxGVBtrydAg.text: Came here on a Saturday night around 5:30, patio seating. Awesome service and awesome burgers! Try the buffalo tots, for sure a great starter! Truffle burger was our choice and it was out of this world. Loved the vibe and energy of this CBC out of all the ones I've been too!

uGKpZjtohfbPK2VcVWqvuQ.text: Ok, this place has s'mores that you make at the table. I am not kidding. They actually bring you the ingredients & a little fire pot. It's amazing & wonderful.   I'll give you that their name is a bit lame, but the service is good, & fast. I've only tried the tater tots & s'mores, because I'm a grownup, so I can't speak to the other food. I had a really refreshing cocktail with cucumber & mint, which was nice too.   If you go for nothing else, go with friends for drinks & make s'mores with them. It's the best.

aWhOxcxaHt1mqIFT07GyTw.text: The burger was very flavorous. We got the mac and cheese burger medium rare and it was cooked perfect. The server Valentina is her name I think? She has black long hair and glasses was awesome! We wanted a half order of the classic tot. Even though they said they don't so that anymore she figure out something that works for us! Will for sure go back again because of her.

Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mac and cheese burger with classic tot

fneINJbU_HBC-igjIPvVaw.text: This is the place in Old Town to watch a game. Great food huge patio and great staff. Best Beer selection around. Hint, parking is tough so utilize the parking garage just off 3rd or 5th Ave

4bVFsDQIx6uoSlnwGsRlTg.text: Really enjoyed this place! Great beer and super fantastic perfect amount of creaminess to my mac and cheese. I created my own Mac n cheese as it was on special that day and wow it turned out great...Loaded with grilled chicken breast strips broccoli mushrooms- they did not cheap out! Honestly the best Mac n cheese of my life. It really was mmm mmm mm.  Our server was very friendly, bubbly and helped me decide with so much patience.

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Created my own Mac n cheese

ROwkgsvcJ-TuSUKD3i-PGg.text: This was a pretty cool spot to go after a quick hike up to Hole in the Rock 10 minutes away.  We're here for a wedding in Mesa Saturday so this being our first time in Phoenix/Scottsdale, we were pretty lost.  Destry was our waitress who hooked us up with some local suggestions for tourist spots and she recommended coming back tonight since this and Mill St were local hotspots to hang.  My wife and I split the Steakhouse burger and the Hot & Smokey Mac and cheese.  Delicious.  Who woulda thunk asparagus and Mac and cheese worked?  Kudos to the chef who developed the menu for this!  The best finds are those discovered spur of the moment.  We'll have to come back for the beers!

zIITT5hdIET1_8ltYA_8ZQ.text: The burger and fries were awesome. But they took forever to take my order then they took forever to bring my check then took forever to come back with my check. The whole thing took about 2 hours and it wasn't even busy. I was also eating alone.   They have two large bars so it's great for drinking and watching the game. I would say come eat here but just know that you might be the unlucky one that end up in there for far longer than you should be. Awesome food though.

Q5DyWCadvb_ZX_ACmSCIEQ.text: When you get surprised at the service and the food at a 3 star review restaurant.   Jordan are waitress was busy but directed us to do the build your own man and cheese Monday night bowl for 13.50$.  She was right. The Mac and cheese is good and the build your own for 13.50$ is a stellar deal.    Tuesday is all beer in cans for 3$  Wednesday build your burger for 13.50$ Monday build your own Mac and cheese for 13.50$  Jordan was awesome. Best waitress ever. Thanks for a great experience!!!  5 stars

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Build your own Mac and cheese Monday $13.50

PwJQtSdKQRq6RFM0FU5_0w.text: Feel like having some Big Azz Nachos! While watching the AZ Cardinals opening game of these season ! Place is jumpin!! Great atmosphere for grabbing your game ! Take the burger challenge ! I dare ya !!!

TNg0hFaxA7Wb3zdJZe2xhQ.text: We meant to stop by this place multiple times. Finally had a chance in the 4th of July!  Quickly seated and the waitress was quick to get our food ordered. Quick efficient service throughout our time there  My wife tried the impossible burger and loved it!  I tried the spicy burger with turkey instead of chicken. The best part was the sweet potato tots. They had just enough spice!  Overall great experience and the food was reasonably priced!  Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

3D6VkajJE4ubh95IIw2qVA.text: I should've followed my instincts and avoided this restaurant.   CB&CB, as they like to call themselves, offered myself and my new in-laws a terrible experience. This review will be based entirely on the service. The food was decent, but nothing memorable. I've had better at other restaurants (shout out to Rehab!).   Three problems that will guarantee we never recommend this place:   1) Makayla, our server, did a poor job at serving. While she took our orders, brought out the drinks and napkins, she disappeared soon after. After we finished eating, we waited for about 15 minutes for her to show up. The guys at the other table also played the waiting game. Eventually one of the guys from that table went inside looking for her. She took their orders and disappeared again. Finally, my father in law went in to look for her so we that we could get our check. Fast food restaurants offer better service.   2) Everything was so SLOW. The food came out slowly, the service was slow. We weren't in any particular rush, but there was a constant feeling of having been forgotten. We sat on the patio on a Sunday night. No wait, half the tables were vacant.   3) Nickel and dimed: DO NOT SPLIT AN ENTREE. We split a burger and ended up paying 7 dollars for it. First, splitting any entree is 2 dollars. On principle, I didn't want to but I did. Fine, I agreed to that. The pretzel bun was a dollar. Also agreed. But then you order normal fries and that's an extra $2 dollars, multiplied by 2 because of the split = $4. 7 dollars extra to split a burger and fries with a pretzel buns. Shout out again to Rehab, where the same configuration doesn't cost a dime extra.   This combination of events has made me a very unhappy customer. Frankly, it's embarrassing to bring new people to a restaurant where the experience is so bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Receipt. $7 to split a burger with a pretzel bun and normal fries.

pV3T2xzJ6C4nX9VhyMm0vQ.text: Wow well let's start from our rude ass waitress who brings out our food cold and then says to us she is busy doing other things. Oh and wait our food is cold especially the tater tots oh and what's the point of an appetizer when you bring with rest of our food ? Hmm what great experience ins Scottsdale our first night. Oh and our side salad went missing and our waitress never came back we had to have a bus grab it for us.

Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cold and brown guacamole? Must&#39;ve been sitting in kitchen forever!

DhTanBz4krvcaiNbR4Ptnw.text: Awesome place! Great food Great service. Has a GREAT sports atmosphere. All the employees hustle and help each other out!  Prices are very reasonable.  Everyone was having fun watching multiple college games on the array of TVs.  Rachel was the best. Very engaging and fun.  Highly recommend.

IsSADdcASEXv6pWFkxWe5Q.text: One of my best friends was visiting for her birthday and I thought it would be awesome to take a walk through Old Town. One our walk, we stumbled upon this place and decided to check it out. So glad we did! Their menu is HUGE and there are soooo many options that it was hard to choose. I found it easier to just do a custom burger because the menu was intense. I highly recommend the Mac n cheese btw! Also, they have a lot of local beers and also your typical microbrews and domestics.   Parking: I always love free parking (who doesn't). Right behind the restaurant is a parking garage that goes 3 hour free parking during the week.   Service: all the servers are running their asses off and give good advice if you're ever in a bind on what to order. Be sure to read their shirts too...the merchandise is awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Custom grilled chicken burger with a side of Mac n cheese!

JqRru3LPsr1WalewfeW_aA.text: Sorry really wanted to like this place. If cheeseburger is part of your name. You should make a really good one.  Had a better burger at the embassy resorts pool the other day. Took two hours to have lunch.  We weren't in a hurry until after we left.   Also  the how me your tips shirts weren't very classy. Y'all can do better.

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ZGL8j0gOlZ5ovNM4LmCilw.text: I gave this place a 3 star because they made us WAIT forever! We called and asked what the wait time was for a party of 4 ( 2 adults and 2 kids) Lady told us there was no wait time. We were 5 minutes away from the restaurant. When we arrived, the 2 ladies looked at us and maybe kind of freaked out we had 2 kids with us. Our daughters are 8 and 16. We were there for a pre bday dinner celebration. It was a day before my husbands 40th bday and he LOVES cheeseburger and beers.   Anyways, we waited for about 25/30 mins before we were seated. There was no place to wait inside or outside. So we stood outside next to the Lyft waiting area. Now I know this is old town Scottsdale on a Friday night....i get it...theres drunk asses everywhere. But if I knew the wait would have been THAT long I would not have gone with my girls.   Ok, for service and food. Our waiter was super nice!!! She was definitely more professional then the greeters. We enjoyed her and how knowledgeable she was about the menu and how attentive she was.  She noticed that we were celebrating a bday and wished my husband a happy bday and gave him a complimentary drink. =) THANK YOU!!   The food was also GREAT! Husband had his beer and create your own cheeseburger and loved it. I was brave and tried the peanut butter and jelly cheeseburger. It's was also good!   Overall, it was an ok experience. I think next time I will try other locations tho.

photos.caption: Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. That&#39;s my peanut butter and jelly cheeseburger with the house chips and my cutie pie daughter

Photo of Cold Beers & Cheeseburgers - Old Town - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hubby with his free beer!

hcfjp9UvEZWJ6jMoINtbpQ.text: We came here just for drinks because their drink prices were reasonable. I had a Rekorderlig Passion Fruit and a coworker had a Strongbow Cherry Blossom - we loved both of them! The extensive beer menu should appease any beer lover! Our waitress checked on us but was not too friendly and neither smiled, other than that, we liked it here. By the way, we came on a Friday night around 8pm and the wait was 15 minutes.

xLz1axhoVFYoSVZg40yGQQ.text: Wow! What a disappointing experience. Not only did we have a long wait to get seated, but it took the waitress over 30 minutes to get our DRINK order. To top it off, once we did get our order in, it took another 30 minutes to get our drinks. The restaurant is practically empty and yet the service is as if the restaurant is a full house, disappointing. My recommendation, skip this place not worth the wait and not worth the food. I hope management reads this and makes some changes because this is ridiculous.

Rtxo0obErTP4SbbcnK5Y8g.text: Ok It's got sports and beer I've had better food on airplanes  If you want a beer and want to watch sports  Ok Just stay away from the menu

d0_7Sx0erA1BAIr_B3reTg.text: Almost gave them 4 stars for the minor mistake with my order of a stuffed burger but the customer service I received helped me forget. Not only was my server great but the burger was still one of the best burgers I've ever. The beer sampler of the blue moon style beers was bomb and my server made sure we were taken care of and needed nothing else the whole time. I know theres other cold beer and cheeseburger, but just for the service alone would be worth the drive for me to come back again.

AS7iUvhinpUDr-hsc6SYPA.text: Stopped in before a book signing for a quick happy hour. Their service was good but not overbearing and the food was good.

GA48Dlg6zZLdojz_TLHPFA.text: Prolly rate this place a 3.5.  Just good if you wanna just drink regular beers paying lil extra money. Ordered - Vegan Patty with Asparagus : patty tasted good. Had the texture of beef and sprinkled with sea salt. Yes, it is over priced for a patty and the quantity you get.  Beer menu was not astounding..just usual stuff and a good one time visit American restaurant.

sENsA8MvNYae06yEsrSoSg.text: Great for beer selection and lots of tvs, so if sports and beer is the goal, go here!  However, the vegan options in their food menu (heck even vegetarian options) are pretty much non-existent, which is a huge bummer for me. The old town location didn't have the Impossible burger during spring training (may not get it back at all from what I understand), and they don't run happy hour specials during spring training.  Ugh.

ayCoro2UKqoD4lR-XB3IyA.text: Great spot. Makayla is such a fun server. Right in the middle of Old Town Scottsdale. Fun outside patio and indoor bar. The Tot Chos are delish. Even when it's 108 outside.enjoy!
